function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Rapid response service may deliver low-quality evidence due to time constraints and urgency, leading to incorrect decision-making.","Impact":"Increased risk of incorrect policy decisions and ineffective public health responses.","Mitigation":"Establish clear guidelines for evidence assessment and vetting processes, prioritize existing systematic reviews, and involve multi-disciplinary expert panels in the evidence synthesis process.","Technologies":"Automated evidence synthesis tools, natural language processing algorithms for rapid evidence screening, and decision support systems for evidence-based policy making.","People":"Decision-makers, stakeholders, and the public.","Owner":"Public health authorities, research institutions, and policy makers."},{"Description":"Lack of flexibility and capability in KT platforms to switch to rapid response mode during a crisis.","Impact":"Inability to provide timely and relevant evidence to decision-makers, resulting in delayed or insufficient public health responses.","Mitigation":"Develop and maintain adaptable KT platforms with pre-defined rapid response protocols, access to updated databases, and contingency plans for resource reallocation during crises.","Technologies":"Adaptive knowledge management systems, cloud-based data storage and retrieval infrastructure, and real-time data analytics tools.","People":"Knowledge translation (KT) platform operators and administrators.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research organizations, and crisis management authorities."},{"Description":"Insufficient resources and funding for operationalizing the rapid response service, leading to delays and inadequacies in evidence provision.","Impact":"Inability to deliver timely and high-quality evidence, compromising the effectiveness of public health decision-making.","Mitigation":"Establish emergency funding mechanisms for rapid response services, engage in partnerships for resource sharing, and develop cost-effective rapid response templates and processes.","Technologies":"Resource allocation optimization tools, collaborative project management platforms, and crowdfunding solutions for public health emergencies.","People":"Public health researchers, knowledge translation professionals, and crisis response teams.","Owner":"Government health departments, public health funding agencies, and philanthropic organizations."}]}
